instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Severely fucked macbook arrived, cable to one fan is cut keyboard connector has been molested and the battery connection block thing was put in the wrong way round.
After putting the battery connector block in the right way, it chimes and boots but no image. External display working fine, the display connector hasn't been fucked with. I can see all the pins inside and they look perfect and so does the cable, unfortunately, havent got any extra 13" retina screens to test


<SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: First thing is to check with a known good LCD then check for missing components in the eDP lines to the LCD connector.
